  • Method Details

    • shift

      public static java.lang.String shift​(java.lang.String s, int n)
      Encipher a string using a shift cipher. Each letter is replaced by a letter 'n' letters to the right of the original. Thus for example, all shift values evenly divisible by 26 (the length of the English alphabet) replace a letter with itself. Non-letters are left unchanged.
      Parameters:
      s - string to encipher
      n - the number of letters to shift
      Returns:
      the original plaintext string

    • substitute

      public static java.lang.String substitute​(java.lang.String s, java.lang.String ciphertext)
      Encipher a string using the letter positions in ciphertext. Each letter is replaced by the letter in the same ordinal position in the ciphertext. Non-letters are left unchanged.
      Parameters:
      s - string to encipher
      ciphertext - ciphertext alphabet
      Returns:
      the plaintext string

    • allDigits

      public static boolean allDigits​(java.lang.String str)
      Determines if a string contains all digits.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to test.
      Returns:
      true if str is all digits, false otherwise.

    • closest

      public static double closest​(double target, double v1, double v2)
      Determines closest value of two values to a target value.
      Parameters:
      target - the target value
      v1 - first comparison value
      v2 - second comparison value
      Returns:
      one of v1 or v2 that is closest to target, v1 is the value chosen if v1 and v2 are an equal distance from target

      target - value to search for
      Returns:
      true if target in values, false otherwise

      high - high value of the lottery number range
      Returns:

      Parameters:
      s - a string
      Returns:
      true if s is a palindrome, false otherwise

    • isValid

      public static boolean isValid​(java.lang.String name)
      Determines if name is a valid Java variable name. Variables names must start with a letter or an underscore, but cannot be an underscore alone. The rest of the variable name may consist of letters, numbers and underscores.
      Parameters:
      name - a string to test as a Java variable name
      Returns:
      true if name is a valid Java variable name, false otherwise

    • matrixStats

      public static double[] matrixStats​(double[][] a)
      Determines the smallest, largest, total, and average of the values in the 2D list a. You may assume there is at least one value in a and that a is a square matrix - i.e. the number of columns per row is the same. a must be unchanged.
      Parameters:
      a - - a 2D list of numbers (2D list of double)
      Returns:
      a list of four double values containing the smallest number in a,the largest number in a, the total of all numbers in a, and the average of all numbers in a, in that order.

    • numCategories

      public static int[] numCategories​(int[] numbers)
      Counts and returns how may positives, negatives, and zeroes there are in an array of integers.
      Parameters:
      numbers - array of int
      Returns:
      number of negative values, number of zero values, number of positive values

    • pigLatin

      public static java.lang.String pigLatin​(java.lang.String word)
      Converts a word to Pig Latin. The conversion is:
      • if a word begins with a vowel, add "way" to the end of the word.
      • if the word begins with consonants, move the leading consonants to the end of the word and add "ay" to the end of that. "y" is treated as a consonant if it is the first character in the word, and as a vowel for anywhere else in the word.
      Preserve the case of the word - i.e. if the first character of word is upper-case, then the new first character should also be upper case.
      Parameters:
      word - The string to convert to Pig Latin
      Returns:
      the Pig Latin version of word

    • sumPartialHarmonic

      public static double sumPartialHarmonic​(int n)
      Sums and returns the total of a partial harmonic series. This series is the sum of all terms 1/i, where i ranges from 1 to n (inclusive).
      Parameters:
      n - an integer
      Returns:
      sum of partial harmonic series from 1 to n

    • validSn

      public static boolean validSn​(java.lang.String sn)
      Determines if a string is a good serial number. Good serial numbers are of the form 'SN/nnnn-nnn', where 'n' is a digit.
      Parameters:
      sn - The serial number to test.
      Returns:
      true if the serial number is valid in form, false otherwise.

    • validSnFile

      public static void validSnFile​(java.util.Scanner fileIn, java.io.PrintStream goodSns, java.io.PrintStream badSns)
      Evaluates serial numbers from a file. Writes valid serial numbers to good_sns, and invalid serial numbers to bad_sns.
      Parameters:
      fileIn - a file already open for reading
      goodSns - a file already open for writing
      badSns - a file already open for writing
